org.jamesframework.core.search

Class LocalSearch<SolutionType extends Solution>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamesframework.core.search.Search<SolutionType>
      • org.jamesframework.core.search.LocalSearch<SolutionType>
  • Type Parameters:
    SolutionType - solution type of the problems that may be solved using this search, required to extend Solution
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LRSubsetSearch, NeighbourhoodSearch, PipedLocalSearch

    public abstract class LocalSearch<SolutionType extends Solution>
extends Search<SolutionType>
    Local searches are searches that start from an initial solution and modify this solution in an attempt to improve it. The initial solution can be specified using setCurrentSolution(Solution) before running the search, else, a random initial solution is used. The current solution is retained across subsequent runs of a local search. This means that upon restarting a local search, it will continue from where it had arrived in the previous run.
    Author:
    Herman De Beukelaer

                   Problem<SolutionType> problem)

        Parameters:

        name - custom search name
        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • searchStarted

        protected void searchStarted()
        When the search is started, a random initial solution is generated if none has been specified.
        Overrides:

      • generateRandomInitialSolution

        protected void generateRandomInitialSolution()
        Generates a random initial solution. Called from searchStarted().
        Throws:
        SearchException - if a current solution is already set when calling this method

      • getCurrentSolution

        public SolutionType getCurrentSolution()
        Get the current solution. Might be worse than the best solution found so far. The current solution is retained across subsequent runs of a local search. May return null if no current solution has been set yet, for example when the search has just been created or is still initializing.
        Returns:
        current solution, if set; null otherwise

      • getCurrentSolutionEvaluation

        public Evaluation getCurrentSolutionEvaluation()
        Get the evaluation of the current solution. The current solution is retained across subsequent runs of a local search. May return null if no current solution has been set yet, for example when the search has just been created or is still initializing.
        Returns:
        evaluation of current solution, if already defined; null otherwise

      • getCurrentSolutionValidation

        public Validation getCurrentSolutionValidation()
        Get the validation of the current solution. The current solution is retained across subsequent runs of a local search. May return null if no current solution has been set yet, for example when the search has just been created or is still initializing.
        Returns:
        validation of current solution, if already defined; null otherwise

      • setCurrentSolution

        public void setCurrentSolution(SolutionType solution)
        Sets the current solution prior to execution or in between search runs. The given solution is evaluated and validated, and it is checked whether it is a valid first/new best solution. This method may for example be used to specify a custom initial solution before starting the search. Note that it may only be called when the search is idle.
        Parameters:
        solution - current solution to be adopted
        Throws:
        SearchException - if the search is not idle
        NullPointerException - if solution is null

      • updateCurrentSolution

        protected void updateCurrentSolution(SolutionType solution)
        Update the current solution during search. The solution is evaluated and validated but the update takes place regardless of the actual obtained evaluation and validation. More precisely, it is not required that the current solution is valid.
        Parameters:
        solution - new current solution

      • updateCurrentSolution

        protected void updateCurrentSolution(SolutionType solution,
                                     Evaluation evaluation,
                                     Validation validation)
        Update the current solution during search, given that it has already been evaluated and validated. The new current solution and its evaluation/validation are stored and attached local search listeners are informed about this update. The update always takes place, it is not required that the current solution is valid.
        Parameters:
        solution - new current solution
        evaluation - evaluation of new current solution
        validation - validation of new current solution

      • updateCurrentAndBestSolution

        protected boolean updateCurrentAndBestSolution(SolutionType solution)
        Update the current and best solution during search. The given solution is evaluated and validated, followed by an update of the current solution (also if it is invalid). Conversely, the best solution is only updated if the given solution is valid and improves over the best solution found so far.
        Parameters:
        solution - new current solution
        Returns:
        true if the best solution has been updated

      • updateCurrentAndBestSolution

        protected boolean updateCurrentAndBestSolution(SolutionType solution,
                                               Evaluation evaluation,
                                               Validation validation)
        Update the current and best solution during search, given that the respective solution has already been evaluated and validated. The current solution is always updated, also if it is invalid. Conversely, the best solution is only updated if the given solution is valid and improves over the best solution found so far.
        Parameters:
        solution - new current solution
        evaluation - evaluation of new current solution
        validation - validation of new current solution
        Returns:
        true if the best solution has been updated
